sections.title: Major Milestone: GC Secure Artifacts Platform Launch
sections.content: Shared Services Canada is pleased to announce the successful launch of GC Secure Artifacts, now operational for unclassified workloads across all federal departments and agencies. This initiative represents a significant advancement in the Government of Canada's digital transformation and cybersecurity strategy.

highlight_box.title: Strategic Platform Benefits
items: Centralized Security Management: Unified artifact repository with enterprise grade security controls
Zero Vulnerability Container Images: Chainguard's security first approach to base images
Cost Optimization: Shared infrastructure reducing departmental procurement overhead
Compliance Framework: Built in audit trails and security scanning capabilities
Supply Chain Protection: End to end visibility and vulnerability management

subsections.title: JFrog Enterprise+ Platform
subsections.content: The Government of Canada has successfully procured and deployed the JFrog Platform (Enterprise Plus), providing comprehensive DevSecOps capabilities:

feature_cards.title: Universal Artifact Repository
feature_cards.content: Centralized storage and management for Docker containers, Maven artifacts, NPM packages, NuGet packages, Helm charts, and additional package formats.

feature_cards.title: Advanced Security Scanning
feature_cards.content: Integrated JFrog Xray vulnerability detection with automated policy enforcement and continuous security monitoring.

feature_cards.title: Enterprise Access Controls
feature_cards.content: Role based permissions, repository segmentation, and fine grained access management aligned with government security requirements.

feature_cards.title: Compliance and Audit
feature_cards.content: Complete audit trails, build information tracking, and compliance reporting capabilities for regulatory requirements.

subsections.title: Chainguard Secure Container Images
subsections.content: Our strategic partnership with Chainguard delivers the industry's most secure container base images:

feature_cards.title: Zero-CVE Architecture
feature_cards.content: No known security vulnerabilities in our curated container image collection, providing a secure foundation for application development.

feature_cards.title: Distroless Implementation
feature_cards.content: Minimal attack surface achieved by including only essential runtime components, reducing potential security exposure.

feature_cards.title: Cryptographic Signatures
feature_cards.content: All images are cryptographically signed with comprehensive Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for supply chain transparency.

feature_cards.title: Continuous Updates
feature_cards.content: Automated security patches and updates ensure images remain current with the latest security improvements.

sections.title: Implementation and Onboarding
sections.content: Federal departments and agencies can start using GC Secure Artifacts through this structured onboarding process:

phases.title: Phase 1: Access Request and Authentication
phases.content: Submit access request through the official Government of Canada onboarding form and configure Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication through the 163ENT Entra ID tenant.

phases.title: Phase 2: Development Environment Integration
phases.content: Update existing Dockerfiles to reference secure Chainguard base images and integrate JFrog CLI tools into continuous integration pipelines.

phases.title: Phase 3: Security Configuration
phases.content: Implement automated dependency scanning, container vulnerability assessment, and policy-based security controls within development workflows.

phases.title: Phase 4: Production Deployment
phases.content: Deploy applications using verified artifacts with continuous monitoring, automated compliance reporting, and incident response procedures.

sections.title: GC Secure Artifacts: Introduction to JFrog's Machine Learning (ML) Capabilities
sections.content: We're excited to share with you a recent session we had with JFrog, where they went deep into their ML offering. You can access the recording and presentation materials below:

recording_links.title: AUR-COM-009 - Intro to JFrog ML.mp4 (GCXChange Aurora)
AUR-COM-009 - Intro to JFrog ML.pdf (GCXChange Aurora)

features.intro: During the session, JFrog highlighted the key features of their ML platform, which enables organizations to deploy models to on-premises infrastructure with options for CPU or GPU-based compute. They also showcased advanced features that support the entire ML lifecycle, including:
items: Model drift monitoring to ensure models stay accurate over time
Experiment tracking to optimize model performance
Feature stores to manage and reuse features across models

additional_content: Additionally, JFrog is developing an ML Catalog product, which will allow for curation and secure access to open-source models. This will greatly facilitate the discovery and reuse of existing models, reducing the need for duplication of effort and accelerating the development of new models.

With respect to GC Secure Artifacts, we're really interested in exploring how JFrog's ML capabilities can support potential ML initiatives. However, we need departmental interest and help to move this forward. We believe that JFrog's ML platform has the potential to greatly enhance AI / ML workflows, but we require buy-in and collaboration in order to make this happen.

sections.title: About Aurora
sections.content: Aurora is a cloud native platform built to support collaboration and innovation across government teams. The infrastructure is open, and you're welcome to explore our code and tools on the [Aurora GitHub](https://github.com/gccloudone). For updates and resources, visit the [Aurora Portal](https://aurora.gccloudone.ca).

involvement.title: How You Can Get Involved
items: Join our meetups to connect with others, share ideas, and learn about cloud native technologies.
Contribute to open source by improving documentation, suggesting new features, or sharing feedback.

Participate in a Technical Advisory Group (TAG) focused on: Architecture (platform design, scalability, best practices), Security (zero trust, defense in depth, compliance), or Networking (service mesh, eBPF, multi cluster networking)

sections.community: Stay in the loop by following the GCXchange Aurora Community for news, events, and conversations. If you haven't received an invite yet, reply to this message or email us at [aurora-aurore@ssc-spc.gc.ca](mailto:aurora-aurore@ssc-spc.gc.ca) and we'll make sure you're added.

sections.title: Étape Importante : Lancement de la Plateforme d'Artefacts Sécurisés GC
sections.content: Services partagés Canada est heureux d'annoncer le lancement réussi des Artefacts Sécurisés GC, maintenant opérationnels pour les charges de travail non classifiées dans tous les ministères et organismes fédéraux. Cette initiative représente une avancée significative dans la transformation numérique et la stratégie de cybersécurité du Gouvernement du Canada.

highlight_box.title: Avantages Stratégiques de la Plateforme
items: Gestion Centralisée de la Sécurité : Référentiel d'artefacts unifié avec contrôles de sécurité de niveau entreprise
Images de Conteneurs Sans Vulnérabilité : Approche sécuritaire de Chainguard pour les images de base
Optimisation des Coûts : Infrastructure partagée réduisant les coûts d'approvisionnement ministériels
Cadre de Conformité : Pistes d'audit intégrées et capacités d'analyse de sécurité
Protection de la Chaîne d'Approvisionnement : Visibilité de bout en bout et gestion des vulnérabilités

sections.title: Les artefacts sécurisés de GC : Introduction aux capacités d'apprentissage automatique (ML) de JFrog
sections.content: Nous sommes ravis de partager avec vous une récente séance que nous avons eue avec JFrog, où ils ont approfondi leur offre d'apprentissage automatique. Vous pouvez accéder au enregistrement et aux matériels de présentation ci-dessous :

recording_links.title: AUR-COM-009 - Intro to JFrog ML.mp4 (GCXChange Aurore)
AUR-COM-009 - Intro to JFrog ML.pdf (GCXChange Aurore)

features.intro: Lors de la session, JFrog a mis en avant les caractéristiques clés de leur plateforme d'apprentissage automatique, qui permet aux organisations de déployer des modèles sur des infrastructures en place avec des options pour le traitement par CPU ou par carte graphique. Ils ont également démontré des fonctionnalités avançées qui soutiennent tout le cycle de vie de l'apprentissage automatique, y compris :
items: Surveillance du dérive de modèle pour s'assurer que les modèles restent précis au fil du temps
Suivi des expériences pour optimiser les performances des modèles
Magasins de fonctionnalités pour gérer et réutiliser des fonctionnalités à travers les modèles

additional_content: De plus, JFrog développe un produit de catalogage d'apprentissage automatique, qui permettra de curer et d'accéder de manière sécurisée aux modèles open-source. Cela facilitera grandement la découverte et la réutilisation de modèles existants, réduisant la nécessité de duplication d'efforts et accélérant le développement de nouveaux modèles.

En ce qui concerne les artefacts sécurisés de GC, nous sommes vraiment intéressés à explorer comment les capacités d'apprentissage automatique de JFrog peuvent soutenir les initiatives ML potentielles. Cependant, nous avons besoin de l'intérêt et de l'aide du ministère pour faire progresser cela. Nous pensons que la plateforme d'apprentissage automatique de JFrog a le potentiel de grandement améliorer les workflows AI / ML, mais nous avons besoin d'adhésion et de collaboration pour faire cela.
